frameworks.openingRemark: Node.js is the first and foremost tool to install.
frameworks.theWhy: Node.js handles the installation of open source applications through NPM, the package manager for the Node.js server platform. Node functions as a warehouse of third-party applications, while NPM not only delivers the packages but installs the code and manages the code dependencies. All installations are run through the command line.

steps.list-step: Click the install button and follow the directions
Make sure the package is installed into /usr/local/bin

frameworks.openingRemark: Yeoman scaffolds high quality working web applications. Most projects made by the development team are first built by Yeoman.
frameworks.theWhy: Yeoman combines several functions e.g., creating a starter template, managing dependencies, and providing a local development server. Angular, Assemble, Backbone are the types of projects, but not limited to, that can be instantiated through Yeoman.

frameworks.openingRemark: Sass is a stable, powerful CSS extension, such as allowing mechanisms availble in OO languages.
frameworks.theWhy: Sass supports variable declaration, nesting, mixins, arguments, and selector inheritance.
Handlebars.js is compatible with Mustache.js, but can handel extensibility and minimal logic with #if, #unless, #with, and #each helpers.
